title: (x) Vintage sans, similar to Gill Sans - Metro {Yves}
content:
Here is an image of an old note I’ve recently received. It looks like Gill, but the Q says maybe different. Any Ideas?

 [‹ (x) "Smart ideas come to life…" tech sans in Adobe ad - Neo Tech {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071116143945/http:/typophile.com/node/39041 "Go to previous forum topic") [Help a la 70s? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071116143945/http:/typophile.com/node/39074 "Go to next forum topic")
author: finder

comments.content: That’s W.A. Dwiggin’s Metro, also known as Geometric 415 from Bitstream.
BTW They used the alternate a and g. This looks pre-digital, innit?

You might also like [H&FJ Verlag](http://web.archive.org/) or [Cyrus Highsmith](http://web.archive.org/web/20071116143945/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Cyrus%252BHighsmith)’s [Relay](http://web.archive.org/)
Yes. Pre-digital. No one has had the where with all to release a nice black like that yet.

FontHaus sells the Metro Sans series from GroupType:  
 [http://www.fonthaus.com/products/fonts/view.cfm/sku/GT00100159.cfm](http://web.archive.org/web/20071116143945/http:/www.fonthaus.com/products/fonts/view.cfm/sku/GT00100159.cfm "http://www.fonthaus.com/products/fonts/view.cfm/sku/GT00100159.cfm")

Another option: Metro Office, the odd remix by Akira Kobayashi/Linotype which uses the two-story a and double-bowl g:  
 [http://www.linotype.com/135960/metrooffice-family.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20071116143945/http:/www.linotype.com/135960/metrooffice-family.html "http://www.linotype.com/135960/metrooffice-family.html")

BTW, it’s “wherewithal.” ;)
Thanks, Mark. My spellcheck was no help on that one. :^D

Damn, I didn’t understand what you meant. That’s why! :^D

The new FontShop agenda by Research Studios has a very funny one. Check it on [Unzipped](http://web.archive.org/web/20071116143945/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=238); the image is legible.
Your link isn’t working Yves. Where’s it supposed to go? I want to see.

Weird, it works for me. I just clicked it and it redirected me to [http://www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=238](http://web.archive.org/web/20071116143945/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=238 "http://www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=238").
